Line_References: Both agents deliver comprehensive ABAP to PySpark migration validation scripts with robust error handling, logging, and reconciliation reporting. Key differences include architectural patterns (class vs function-based), testing integration (embedded vs separate), and deployment readiness (development-focused vs production-optimized).

Details: Both outputs address the same core objective of ABAP to PySpark migration validation with nearly identical workflow steps: parsing ABAP/PySpark code, simulating ABAP execution, converting to Parquet, transferring to distributed storage, executing PySpark transformations, comparing results, and generating reconciliation reports. Minor semantic divergence in implementation approach - Agent 1 focuses on educational/development context with embedded testing, while Agent 2 emphasizes production deployment with enterprise configuration management.

Structural differences are notable: Agent 1 uses object-oriented class-based design (ABAPtoPySparkMigrationValidator) with methods for each validation step, while Agent 2 employs functional programming with utility functions and a main() orchestrator. Control flow patterns differ but achieve equivalent outcomes.
